events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - Pre conference on "Implementing a Data Warehouse"
events.description: Dear All, Here we go for the first big announcement of SQL Saturday Singapore 2017!!! We are happy to announce the first pre conference of SQL Saturday Singapore 2017!!! We are proud to have Mr. Dinesh Priyankara, 12 time Data Platform MVP from Srilanka, delivering a one day workshop / training on the topic "Implementing a Data Warehouse with Microsoft SQL Server" on 25th August at Microsoft Singapore. So, if you are an database administrator trying to learn business intelligence or buisness intelligence developer trying to enhance your skills, this is your perfect chance to learn for the best!!!  Detailed course details and registration link provided below.  Block your calender and book your tickets soonest to take full advantage of the super low early bird price of 100$ https://www.eventbrite.com/e/implementing-a-data-warehouse-with-microsoft-sql-server-tickets-35864938998 Please note that, all bookings and registrations are handled only via eventbrite and not on meetup. Please email [masked] for any questions. Regards, Singapore SQL Saturday 2017 Team
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF15, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Open Source Tech Workshop
events.description:
Join us at the open source technical workshop on 25 Aug, brought to you by our partner GeoICON. Programme: - Introduction & hands-on in using Carto - Technical Sharing on OpenLayers - Q & A Session 


* Please bring your own laptop for hands-on session in using Carto * Light refreshment will be provided
events.location: National Design Centre, Level 2 Training Rooms, Singapore

events.name: [DAX Learn] Fintech Friday III: Demystifying the (data) science behind robo-advisory
events.description:
AGENDA
PART 1: 6.00PM - 6.15PM | Overview of data science applications
PART 2: 6.15PM - 6.30PM | Applications of machine learning and statistical modelling in stock trading
PART 3: 6.30PM - 7.30PM | Fireside chat: Real-life applications of data science in Robo-advisory
PART 4: 7.30PM onwards | Networking & food 


SPEAKER DETAILS
Johnson Poh heads the Data Science Practice at Big Data Analytics Center of Excellence in DBS, where he drives the development of core data science capabilities for enhancing decision analysis. He spent his past decade leading teams in applying statistical learning models across government, pharmaceutical as well as financial industries. Johnson received his postgraduate degree in Statistical Computing at Yale University and completed his bachelor degrees in Mathematics, Statistics and Economics at UC Berkeley.
Chandrika Mani is a Senior Data Scientist at the Big Data Analytics Center of Excellence in DBS, where she develops machine learning models to help solve business challenges. She has over 10 years experience in building analytical models across technology consulting, airline, consumer products as well as financial sectors. Chandrika completed her postgraduate studies in Business Analytics at the Institute of Systems Science in NUS.
Aki Ranin is the Founder and COO at Bambu., one of Singapore’s hottest startups. An active blogger on all things Fintech and A.I., he comes from a 15 year background in Technology across Europe and Asia. Bambu is Asia’s leading B2B Robo-Advisor platform, providing solutions for retail, affluent, and private banking. Bambu leverages A.I. to further simplify the process of holistic financial planning through goal-based investing.
Michele Ferrario is the Co-Founder and CEO of StashAway. In the first part of his career, Michele advised large financial institutions; he then joined Rocket Internet as a Managing Director, where he built several consumer internet business in Italy, Pakistan and South East Asia. Michele earned his MBA at Columbia Business School. StashAway is a digital wealth management platform, designed to give to anybody access to a very sophisticated investment framework. With very low fees, no minimum balanc, absolute flexibility, no hidden costs, free unlimited withdrawals and a very intuitive and easy-to-use platform, StashAway is a fast way to reach your financial goals. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Fill in your contact details to sign up for Fintech Friday!
Registration starts at 5.30PM
For enquiries, contact annachung@dbs.com for more information.
events.location: DBS Asia X, Sandcrawler Building, 1 Fusionopolis View #07-03, Singapore 138577

events.name: SGX TEC: Scala and Akka in the TITAN OTC Plaform
events.description:
In collaboration with Singapore Exchange (SGX) we're pleased to announce a showcase of the use of Scala and Akka in their TITAN OTC platform as part of the SGX Technology Symposium. This is a private event with only 50 tickets available for Meetup group members, please register for this free event with the password "SGX Scala MeetUp" at: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/scala-meetup-sgx-tec-symposium-tickets-36040275434 Please note a strict business casual dress code apply, attendees with inappropriate attire may be refused admission.  Summary: The SGX Technology Symposium is a platform for all IT leaders and innovators to discuss the latest technology industry trends, featuring analyst presentations, networking opportunities and keynotes by top CEOs. Titan OTC is an over-the-counter (OTC) trade registration platform launched by SGX in September 2016. Theplatform contains a wide range of features, supporting a comprehensive OTC trade workflow and offering a richuser experience. 


Agenda: 5:45 pm -- Registration & Networking6:20 pm -- Proceed to SGX Academy6:30 pm -- Opening and Announcement by Singapore Scala Programmers Meetup group and SGX Organizers6:40 pm -- Introduction to TITAN OTC6:50 pm -- Scala and Akka in the TITAN OTC platform7:30 pm -- Dinner and Networking
events.location: SGX Academy Room, SGX Centre 1, Level 2, 2 Shenton Way, Singapore

events.name: Friday Hacks #135: Welcome Tea
events.description:
Friday Hacks are back for this new academic year!

Please join us in our Welcome Tea, where our President will share about what we do, the importance of fostering hacker culture in NUS and how to hack life!

All freshmen & current students from all faculties are welcome to attend. As always, free pizza starts at 6.30pm ;)

Read on to get a quick idea of what we do:
NUS Hackers is a student-run organization committed to the spread of hacker culture & free/open-source software. We provide a support system for hackers in NUS who are currently building things (be it for charity, business or pleasure). We also hold workshops, organize weekly meet-ups, run hackathons, and maintain open source code for the NUS community.

Supported by The HANGAR by NUS Enterprise — THE campus hub for entrepreneurs.

Event Website: http://www.nushackers.org/post/2017-08-25-friday-hacks-135-aug-25/
events.location: Seminar Room 1, School of Computing, National University of Singapore,

events.name: Why Julia, and how to get started?
events.description: Speaker: Kendrick Amezquita Semprun  Kendrick received his BS degree in Electronics Engineering from the National Experimental University of the Armed Forces (UNEFA), Maracay, Venezuela in 2005. In 2010, he received the Doctor of Engineering degree in Control Theory and Control Engineering from Beihang University, Beijing, China. During[masked], he worked as a Research Personnel at the Bolivarian Agency of Space Activities (ABAE) and as an Assistant Professor in the Department of System Engineering at UNEFA. He is now a Research Fellow with the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the National University of Singapore (NUS).  His research interests include adaptive control, intelligent control, intelligent transportation systems, and robotics. Summary  In this brief talk, we will be discussing Julia language as an appealing and efficient alternative for numerical computing. We will dive into Julia's syntax and explore its advantages as a high-level dynamic programming language with no performance compromise. Specifically, we will be covering: how to get started in Julia, similarities between Julia and other programming languages, what makes Julia stand out, basic examples, tools for profiling and optimizing your code,  advanced examples.
events.location: IMDA PIXEL Labs@NDC, 111 Middle Road #03-04, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969
